verbose_text: Collectively, these studies show that intracellular accumulation of ceramide, most likely in the ER but possibly also in the inner leaflet of the plasma membrane, mediates the activation of PP2A, Ulk, and Beclin and finally induces autophagy upon treatment of cells with amitriptyline or D609.
evidence: ceramide, most likely in the ER but possibly also in the inner leaflet of the plasma membrane, mediates the activation of PP2A, Ulk, and Beclin and finally induces autophagy
